name: Shariah Compliance Function (Ex-Ante Review)
description: Ex-ante Shariah compliance review before transaction execution. SCO verifies that transaction structure and documentation comply with SSB resolutions and Shariah requirements

steps.title: Prepare Transaction Package for SCO Review
steps.description: Compile all transaction documentation for Shariah Compliance Officer's ex-ante review

requiredEvidence.description: Executive summary of transaction structure, parties, amounts, and timeline
All contracts to be executed (customer-facing and operational)
Reference to applicable SSB resolution approving this product type
Self-assessment checklist showing compliance with SSB requirements

policyConstraints.constraint: All transactions must undergo ex-ante Shariah compliance review before execution

steps.title: SCO Ex-Ante Compliance Review
steps.description: Shariah Compliance Officer conducts detailed review to verify transaction complies with Shariah requirements and SSB resolutions

requiredEvidence.description: Detailed report documenting SCO's compliance assessment
SCO's completed checklist verifying each Shariah requirement
Assessment of Shariah non-compliance risk (SNCR) for this transaction
Any conditions or objections raised by SCO that must be addressed

policyConstraints.constraint: SCO must review contracts, terms, and conditions to ensure Shariah compliance
SCO must have sufficient authority and independence to object to non-compliant transactions

steps.title: SCO Approval or Remediation
steps.description: SCO provides formal approval for transaction to proceed, or requires remediation if issues identified

requiredEvidence.description: Formal written approval from SCO authorizing transaction to proceed
If issues identified, plan for addressing SCO's concerns before execution
Documentation of any conditions that must be met during execution

policyConstraints.constraint: Transaction cannot proceed without SCO approval

note: Ex-ante review is preventive - it catches Shariah compliance issues BEFORE transaction execution. This is distinct from ex-post review (qat-scr-001) which audits after execution.
